derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'dishonour, sexual misconduct'): from Old French deshoneste 'indecency' (see dishonest)

means.word_mean: 2. lack of honesty; acts of lying or cheating or stealing

Sentence.sentence: There are many examples of the vast harm that is caused when individuals forget or ignore the effect their dishonesty can have.

sentences.en: He has acquired a reputation for dishonesty.
Don’t listen to him.His ideas smell of dishonesty.
sentences.cn: 不要听他的,他的主意听上去不诚实。

sentences.en: A minister has ultimate responsibility for mistakes and dishonesty in a government department.
sentences.cn: 政府部门发生的失误和渎职行为应由部长负基本责任。

sentences.en: Lying is a form of dishonesty.
sentences.cn: 说谎是一种不诚实的表现。
